info.title: XiVO Dird
info.description:
Contacts and directories in XiVO are managed by the xivo-dird daemon. This service provides a public API that can be used to query the directories that are configured on a XiVO. 


A contact can contain various information such as a person's phone number, number, office number, department, office number, etc. The information displayed is selected via a profile. Directories can be aggregated using multiple data sources such as an LDAP server, a CSV file, another XiVO server, etc.


Please refer to [the documentation](http://documentation.xivo.io) for further details.


Note: The 0.1 API is currently in development. Major changes could still happen and new resources will be added over time.

get.summary: Given informations about how make request lookup for Aastra Phones
get.description: The `input` query will return a XML to give informations about how make request lookup for Aastra Phones.

get.summary: Search for contacts with Aastra Phones
get.description:
The `lookup` query will return a list of result matching the searched term formated for Aastra Phones. The result will be retrieved from all configured directories for the given profile.


This route is provided by the `aastra_view` plugin using the `lookup` plugin and all configured sources for the given profile.

get.summary: Extends the directories menu for Cisco Unified IP Phones
get.description: The `menu` query will return a XML to extend the directories menu for Cisco Unified IP Phones.

200.description: XML to extend the directories menu

The `lookup` query will return a list of result matching the searched term. The result will be retrieved from all configured directories for the given profile.


This route is provided by the `default_json_view` plugin using the `lookup` plugin and all configured sources for the given profile.
Column headers that can be used when displaying lookup results to the client

The `reverse` query will return a contact matching the searched exten. The result will be retrieved from all configured directories for the given profile.


This route is provided by the `default_json_view` plugin using the `reverse` plugin and all configured sources for the given profile.
Get the list of favorite contacts for directories configured in the profile

put.description: Add the contact from {directory} to the list of favorite contacts.

delete.description: Remove the contact from {directory} from the list of favorite contacts.

get.description: Get the list of personal contacts formatted for the profile
CSV format is the same as `/import`, where headers of all contacts are mixed. The charset of the response is always `utf-8`. Errors are always formatted in JSON.

204.description: No contacts are available (CSV format only).

get.description: Returns the details of the personal contact.

put.description: Replace personal contact's attributes. Omitted attributes will be removed. Attribute `id` can not be changed.

parameters.name: contact
parameters.description: The new attributes of the contact

post.summary: Import multiple personal contacts at once

parameters.name: contacts
parameters.description: The attributes of the contacts in CSV format. The encoding must be set in the Content-Type header, via the `charset=` option. Field delimiter is `,`, quoting character is `"` and line delimiter is `\r\n`

201.description: At least one contact has been created.

400.description: Input could not be decoded, and no contacts were created.

AnotherServiceUnavailable.description: Another service is unavailable (e.g. xivo-auth, consul, ...)

LimitOffsetInvalid.description: The limit or offset should be positive

PersonalContactIDInvalid.description: The personal contact does not exist

AcceptLanguage.name: Accept-Language
AcceptLanguage.description: The language to translate the query results in

Directory.name: directory
Directory.description: The directory where the contact is stored.

Exten.name: exten
Exten.description: A search exten to look for

FavoriteID.name: contact
FavoriteID.description: The ID of the contact. This ID is unique within the {directory}.

Limit.name: limit
Limit.description: The limit defines the number of individual objects that are returned

Limit8.name: limit
Limit8.description: The limit defines the number of individual objects that are returned

Limit16.name: limit
Limit16.description: The limit defines the number of individual objects that are returned

Offset.name: offset
Offset.description: The offset defines the offsets the start by the number specified

PersonalContactID.name: contact_id
PersonalContactID.description: The ID of the personal contact.

Profile.name: profile
Profile.description: The profile defines the list of directories to query and how the results are displayed. Used to generate lookup URL

ProxyUrl.name: Proxy-URL
ProxyUrl.description: URL that will be integrated in the XML response. (not working on swagger 2.1)

Term.name: term
Term.description: A search term to look for

timestamp.description: Time at which the error occured

reason.description: Human readable explanation of the error

term.description: Search term used for these results

exten.description: A search exten to look for
